title: Electric force and work - triangle and 3 charges

content.description: Two small spheres, each with positive charge <math alttext="positive uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math>, are fixed in place at two corners of an equilateral triangle, as shown in the figure. Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is at the other corner, and Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is midway between the spheres. A test charge with positive charge <math alttext="positive lowercase q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math> is moved from Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> to Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> at a constant velocity by an external force. The work done by the external force on the moving particle is <math alttext="W sub external" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>ext</mtext></msub></math>, and the work done by the electrostatic forces from the spheres on the moving particle is <math alttext="W sub electrostatic" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>elec</mtext></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly identifies the signs of these quantities?
content.question: <math alttext="W sub external" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>ext</mtext></msub></math><math alttext="W sub electrostatic" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>elec</mtext></msub></math>APositivePositiveBPositiveNegativeCNegativePositiveDNegativeNegative

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
